content.prompt: Which of the following explanations of the effects of United States involvement in the Middle East could Friedman’s point of view best be used to support?

choices.label: As an author during the Great Recession, he provides an example of how spending money in the Middle East was strengthening the national economy.
As a journalist writing for a major newspaper, he provides evidence that engaging in warfare in the Middle East contributed to debates about fossil fuel dependence.
As a U.S. citizen, he demonstrates that attempting to prevent terrorism from the Middle East threatened Americans’ civil liberties.
As an advocate for reform, he reflects the common belief that building oil refineries in the Middle East was causing extensive environmental changes.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the significance of a source's point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience, including how these might limit the use(s) of a source.
